net.dean.jraw.http.oauth

Class Credentials

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.oauth.Credentials

  • public final class Credentials
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for handling any kind of Reddit user and OAuth2 credentials

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Credentials(AuthenticationMethod authenticationMethod, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String clientId, java.lang.String clientSecret, java.util.UUID deviceId, java.lang.String redirectUrl) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Gets how these Credentials are to be used

      Gets the OAuth2 app's ID.
      java.lang.String getClientSecret()
      Gets the OAuth2 app's secret key.
      java.util.UUID getDeviceId()
      Gets a UUID that is unique for every device.
      java.lang.String getPassword() 
      java.net.URL getRedirectUrl() 
      java.lang.String getUsername() 
      static Credentials installedApp(java.lang.String clientId, java.lang.String redirectUrl)
      Creates a new Credentials object for a Reddit app whose type is 'installed app.' All parameters must be non-null.
      static Credentials script(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String clientId, java.lang.String clientSecret)
      Creates a new Credentials object for a Reddit app whose type is 'web app.' All parameters must be non-null.
      static Credentials userless(java.lang.String clientId, java.lang.String clientSecret, java.util.UUID deviceId)
      Creates a new Credentials object for using the API in a user-less context.
      static Credentials userlessApp(java.lang.String clientId, java.util.UUID deviceId)
      Creates a new Credentials object for using the API in a user-less context on an installed application.
      static Credentials webapp(java.lang.String clientId, java.lang.String clientSecret, java.lang.String redirectUrl)
      Creates a new Credentials object for a Reddit app whose type is 'web app.' All parameters must be non-null.

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthenticationMethod

        public AuthenticationMethod getAuthenticationMethod()
        Gets how these Credentials are to be used
        Returns:
        The AuthenticationMethod

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()

      • getPassword

        public java.lang.String getPassword()

      • getClientId

        public java.lang.String getClientId()
        Gets the OAuth2 app's ID. Applicable for all OAuth app types.
        Returns:
        The app's ID

      • getClientSecret

        public java.lang.String getClientSecret()
        Gets the OAuth2 app's secret key. Applicable for all OAuth app types, however, for 'installed app' app types, the secret will always be an empty string. All parameters must be non-null.
        Returns:
        The secret value for the application

      • getDeviceId

        public java.util.UUID getDeviceId()
        Gets a UUID that is unique for every device. Only non-null when instantiated using userlessApp(String, UUID).

      • getRedirectUrl

        public java.net.URL getRedirectUrl()

      • installedApp

        public static Credentials installedApp(java.lang.String clientId,
                       java.lang.String redirectUrl)
        Creates a new Credentials object for a Reddit app whose type is 'installed app.' All parameters must be non-null.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The publicly-available app ID
        Returns:
        A new Credentials

      • script

        public static Credentials script(java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 java.lang.String clientId,
                 java.lang.String clientSecret)
        Creates a new Credentials object for a Reddit app whose type is 'web app.' All parameters must be non-null.
        Parameters:
        username - The app owner's username
        password - The app owner's password
        clientId - The publicly-available app ID
        clientSecret - The secret value for the application
        Returns:
        A new Credentials

      • webapp

        public static Credentials webapp(java.lang.String clientId,
                 java.lang.String clientSecret,
                 java.lang.String redirectUrl)
        Creates a new Credentials object for a Reddit app whose type is 'web app.' All parameters must be non-null.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The publicly-available app ID
        clientSecret - The secret value for the application
        Returns:
        A new Credentials

      • userless

        public static Credentials userless(java.lang.String clientId,
                   java.lang.String clientSecret,
                   java.util.UUID deviceId)
        Creates a new Credentials object for using the API in a user-less context. All parameters must be non-null
        Parameters:
        deviceId - A unique, per-device ID.
        See Also:
        AuthenticationMethod.USERLESS

      • userlessApp

        public static Credentials userlessApp(java.lang.String clientId,
                      java.util.UUID deviceId)
        Creates a new Credentials object for using the API in a user-less context on an installed application. All parameters must be non-null.
        Parameters:
        deviceId - The UUID unique to this device
        See Also:
        AuthenticationMethod.USERLESS_APP
